item.title: The Truth About Software Development—Adding Two People Won't Make a Project Three Times Faster
item.author: xianpeng.shen@gmail.com (Xianpeng Shen)
item.description: In software development, Brooks’s Law states that “adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.” This post uses the analogies of roasted chicken and pregnant women to deeply explore the reasons behind this phenomenon and offers practical solutions.
